thread.title: Saudis Want Fewer Weapons, More Disney in U.S. Business Talks

author: Margherita Stancati
title: Saudis Want Fewer Weapons, More Disney in U.S. Business Talks
text:
LOS ANGELES—Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has courted a slew of American tech and entertainment heavyweights to bring everything from data centers to cinemas to Saudi Arabia, part of his push to transform the country into a more open and dynamic society,
Over the past week, he has met top business executives—from Amazon.com Inc.’s Jeff Bezos and Microsoft Corp.’s Satya Nadella to Walt Disney Co.’s Robert Iger.
In... RELATED VIDEO Why the Saudi Crown Prince Is on a Coast-to-Coast Tour of the U.S. Saudi Arabia's crown prince Mohammed bin Salman is on a tour of the United States, as he presses ahead with his plans to reform Saudi Arabia from an ultraconservative petrostate to a country that is open to business and eager for foreign investment. WSJ's Niki Blasina reports. Photo: Getty.
